definition[0]: to speak or write to someone in order to get an answer, information, or a solution
example[1]: Don’t ask him – he won’t know.
example[2]: That kid’s always asking awkward questions.
example[3]: I asked him where he lived.
example[4]: We’ll have to ask someone the way to the station.
example[5]: Go and ask Tom whether he’s coming tonight.
example[6]: Visitors usually ask about the history of the castle.
example[7]: I’ll ask around, see if I can find you a place to stay.
definition[1]: to make a request for help, advice, information etc
example[8]: If you need anything, you only have to ask.
example[9]: Ask John to mail those letters tomorrow.
example[10]: Karen asked to see the doctor.
example[11]: Some people find it difficult to ask for help.
example[12]: He repeatedly asked Bailey for the report.
example[13]: Ask your mom if you can come with us.
note[9]: ask (somebody) if/whether you can do something
example[14]: Was it too much to ask that he be allowed some privacy?
definition[2]: to want a particular amount of money for something you are selling
example[16]: They’re asking a fortune for that house.
definition[3]: to invite someone to your home, to go out with you etc
example[18]: Let’s ask them to have dinner with us some time.
example[19]: Jerry’s too scared to ask her out.
example[20]: Don’t leave them standing on the doorstep – ask them in!
example[21]: We must ask our new neighbours over for a drink.
definition[4]: if you ask something of someone, you want them to do it for you
example[22]: It would be better if he cooperated, but perhaps I’m asking too much.
example[23]: You have no right to ask anything of me.
example[24]: Expecting the children to do an hour’s homework after school is asking a lot of them.
heading[0]: – Meaning 2: to make a request for help, advice, information etc
example[25]: Don’t be afraid to ask for help.
example[26]: You can call this number to ask for assistance.
example[27]: If you are in any doubt, ask for advice.
example[28]: I wrote asking for information about language classes.
example[29]: At the station he asked for directions to the museum.
example[30]: Please ask for details of the full range of tickets available.
example[31]: Dad always liked being asked for his opinion.
example[32]: Labour councillors asked for our support for the proposal.
example[33]: The two men entered without bothering to ask for permission.
example[34]: When he asked for an explanation, no one could give him an answer.
example[35]: They asked me some difficult questions at the interview
explanation[1]: You  ask someone to do something
example[36]: I asked him to open the window
explanation[2]: You ask someone if or whether something is true
example[37]: Ask them if they want anything to drink
explanation[3]: When you report what someone asked, use a verb in the past tense
example[38]: She asked if I wanted to go
bad_example[1]: She asked if I want to go
definition[5]: to speak or write to someone to get an answer
example[39]: Did you ask about the price?
example[40]: They asked me a lot of questions.
definition[6]: to ask someone for information about something
example[41]: I’m writing to inquire about the job that was advertised in yesterday’s ‘Times’.
definition[7]: to ask a question in a firm or angry way
example[42]: ‘Why didn’t you call me?’, she demanded.
definition[8]: to ask someone questions, to find out if they are suitable for a job, or as part of a television or radio interview
example[43]: When they interviewed me for the job, they didn’t mention the salary.
example[44]: David Letterman has interviewed all the stars.
definition[9]: to officially ask a lot of people in order to find out their opinion on something
example[45]: Over 1,000 people were polled for the report.
example[46]: 64% of the people we polled said that they approved of the way the government had handled the crisis.
heading[3]: to ask someone about a crime
definition[10]: to ask someone a lot of questions in order to get information about a crime
example[47]: He was arrested and questioned by the police.
example[48]: Detectives are interviewing the father of the missing girl.
definition[11]: to ask someone a lot of detailed questions, often in an aggressive way
example[49]: The men were interrogated by the US authorities for over six hours.
definition[12]: to ask someone questions in court about the statements they made
example[50]: A second lawyer began to cross-examine the witness.
display[6]: somebody is helping the police with their inquiries
definition[13]: used in news reports when saying that the police are asking someone questions about a crime – especially when they think this person is guilty, but have not yet charged them
example[51]: He is helping the police with their inquiries in connection with the murder of Diane Jones.
definition[14]: to tell someone you want them to give you something
example[52]: I’m going to ask for a pay rise.
definition[15]: to ask for food or drink in a restaurant
definition[16]: to ask for something in a firm way, insisting that someone gives you what you ask for
example[56]: If the goods are faulty, you can demand a refund.
example[57]: The pilot requested permission to land.
example[58]: I enclose the information you requested.
definition[17]: to ask for something in an urgent way, because you want it very much and will be very unhappy if you do not get it
example[59]: He begged me for some money.
example[60]: I’m not going to plead for forgiveness.
definition[18]: to keep asking someone for something, in an annoying way
example[61]: She keeps nagging me for a new phone.
example[62]: People were pestering him for his autograph.
definition[19]: if someone is asking a particular price for something, that is the price at which they are selling it
example[63]: How much are they asking for their house?
definition[20]: to make someone leave their job
example[64]: The previous manager was asked to leave, after it was found that he had been misusing company funds.
